result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael A. Mackey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
3:38 p.m. Defendant Michael A. Mackey in court with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Richards statement to offer from State - has not had time to review with client - requests recess. Recess 3:39 p.m. 
On record - 3:48 p.m. Schiek states agreement. State moves to dismiss 16cm347 - Granted. Defendant enters no contest plea.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Schiek/Richards/Defendant/Court statement on sentencing.
Court Sentence
WHS/POP - 12 months
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
  Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.
Jail - 10 days With Huber for all purposes. To commence on/before Friday, December 9, 2016 at 4:00 p.m. 
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
Appeal rights given. Payment plan application given.
Adj. 4:03 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for February 13, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

Bail continued. Adj. 2:59 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 15, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

1:54 p.m. Defendant Michael A. Mackey in court, in custody, via video.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - Schiek statement to bail - Defendant states he did not know of court date - moved recently and maybe something got mixed up  - Provides address 458 Iverson Street - was still living on Eagle River Street in May - Court notes that Notice was sent in May in underlying case.  Court sets $ cash bond. Warrants in underlying cases are quashed and bonds reinstated in those cases. Adj. 2:00 p.m.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 15, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

1:44 p.m. Defendant Michael A. Mackey in court.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 16cm13, 15tr3287, 15tr2737, 15tr3169. Court questions defendant as to non-appearance -Defendant states that he contacted PD's office on Monday morning and PD would have someone here today - he is eligible for PD. Defendant states he was really sick at prior court date and thought it was the 18th of February. Bednar statement to bond. Court reinstates previous sig bond. Defendant states he would like payment plan on traffic cases. Defendant has $200 - Court allows defendant to enter payment plan with $200 payment today. Court quashes all warrants. Adj. 1:49 p.m.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 28, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

2:41 p.m. Defendant Michael A. Mackey not in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Based on non- appearance State moves for warrant. Court authorizes warrant. Adj. 2:41 p.m.

1:42 p.m. Defendant Michael A. Mackey in court, via video, in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - Michlig statement to bail - Court sets $ sig bond. Adj. 1:44 p.m.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 1, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
